repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
The `mouse_spec` tests have been refactored to not test the full screen state. This makes it possible to add multigrid tests without a lot of code duplication, which is needed by https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32535

To make that possible, the `any` match of the screen has been improved and a `none` match added.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -480,13 +452,14 @@ describe('ui/mouse/input', function()
         ]])
         api.nvim_set_option_value('tabline', '%@Test@test%X-%5@Test2@test2', {})
         api.nvim_set_option_value('showtabline', 2, {})
-        screen:expect([[
-          {2:test-test2               }|
-          testing                  |
-          mouse                    |
-          support and selectio^n    |
-                                   |
-        ]])
+        screen:expect({
+          any = {
+            '{2:test%-test2               }',
+            'testing',
+            'mouse',
+            'support and selectio^n',

comment_data.body:
nit

```suggestion
      local res = any_or_none(actual_screen_str, expected.any or expected.none, not expected.none)
      if res then
        return res
      end
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -541,22 +548,55 @@ function Screen:expect(expected, attr_ids, ...)
 
     local actual_rows
     if expected.any or grid then
-      actual_rows = self:render(not expected.any, attr_state)
+      actual_rows = self:render(not (expected.any or expected.none), attr_state)
     end
 
-    if expected.any then
-      -- Search for `any` anywhere in the screen lines.
+    local any_or_none = function(screen_str, value, is_any)
+      if value then
+        local v = value
+        if type(v) == 'string' then
+          v = { v }
+        end
+        local msg
+        if is_any then
+          msg = 'Expected (anywhere): "'
+        else
+          msg = 'Expected (nowhere): "'
+        end
+        for _, v2 in ipairs(v) do
+          local test = screen_str:find(v2)
+          if is_any then
+            test = not test
+          end
+          -- Search for `any` anywhere in the screen lines.
+          if test then
+            return (
+              'Failed to match any screen lines.\n'
+              .. msg
+              .. v2
+              .. '"\n'
+              .. 'Actual:\n  |'
+              .. table.concat(actual_rows, '\n  |')
+              .. '\n\n'
+            )
+          end
+        end
+      end
+      return nil
+    end
+    if expected.any or expected.none then
       local actual_screen_str = table.concat(actual_rows, '\n')
-      if not actual_screen_str:find(expected.any) then
-        return (
-          'Failed to match any screen lines.\n'
-          .. 'Expected (anywhere): "'
-          .. expected.any
-          .. '"\n'
-          .. 'Actual:\n  |'
-          .. table.concat(actual_rows, '\n  |')
-          .. '\n\n'
-        )
+      if expected.any then
+        local res = any_or_none(actual_screen_str, expected.any, true)
+        if res then
+          return res
+        end
+      end
+      if expected.none then
+        local res = any_or_none(actual_screen_str, expected.none, false)
+        if res then
+          return res
+        end
       end

@@ -480,13 +452,14 @@ describe('ui/mouse/input', function()
         ]])
         api.nvim_set_option_value('tabline', '%@Test@test%X-%5@Test2@test2', {})
         api.nvim_set_option_value('showtabline', 2, {})
-        screen:expect([[
-          {2:test-test2               }|
-          testing                  |
-          mouse                    |
-          support and selectio^n    |
-                                   |
-        ]])
+        screen:expect({
+          any = {
+            '{2:test%-test2               }',
+            'testing',
+            'mouse',
+            'support and selectio^n',

comment_data.body: This can't be done, it needs to support checking for both `any` and `none` at the same time
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -541,22 +548,55 @@ function Screen:expect(expected, attr_ids, ...)
 
     local actual_rows
     if expected.any or grid then
-      actual_rows = self:render(not expected.any, attr_state)
+      actual_rows = self:render(not (expected.any or expected.none), attr_state)
     end
 
-    if expected.any then
-      -- Search for `any` anywhere in the screen lines.
+    local any_or_none = function(screen_str, value, is_any)
+      if value then
+        local v = value
+        if type(v) == 'string' then
+          v = { v }
+        end
+        local msg
+        if is_any then
+          msg = 'Expected (anywhere): "'
+        else
+          msg = 'Expected (nowhere): "'
+        end
+        for _, v2 in ipairs(v) do
+          local test = screen_str:find(v2)
+          if is_any then
+            test = not test
+          end
+          -- Search for `any` anywhere in the screen lines.
+          if test then
+            return (
+              'Failed to match any screen lines.\n'
+              .. msg
+              .. v2
+              .. '"\n'
+              .. 'Actual:\n  |'
+              .. table.concat(actual_rows, '\n  |')
+              .. '\n\n'
+            )
+          end
+        end
+      end
+      return nil
+    end
+    if expected.any or expected.none then
       local actual_screen_str = table.concat(actual_rows, '\n')
-      if not actual_screen_str:find(expected.any) then
-        return (
-          'Failed to match any screen lines.\n'
-          .. 'Expected (anywhere): "'
-          .. expected.any
-          .. '"\n'
-          .. 'Actual:\n  |'
-          .. table.concat(actual_rows, '\n  |')
-          .. '\n\n'
-        )
+      if expected.any then
+        local res = any_or_none(actual_screen_str, expected.any, true)
+        if res then
+          return res
+        end
+      end
+      if expected.none then
+        local res = any_or_none(actual_screen_str, expected.none, false)
+        if res then
+          return res
+        end
       end

comment_regular_data.body: Thank you so much for this followup! However, I'm surprised we gained lines, since the goal was to reduce line count/verbosity I think 😅  Maybe that's related to what zeer said about "splitting the lines into multiple strings"

I'd rather not do another multi-hour refactoring pass if possible . Especially since I have a solution that can run almost the entire nvim test suite with multigrid internally without any changes to the tests, so the whole excercise would have been unnecessary, if that could have been accepted.

The gained lines are from the additional `any` keys and especially from the negative matching for the scrolling. The verbosity is still greatly reduced when actually adding multigrid support, since the tests don't need to change depending on the mode.

I thought about combining lines, but it won't work for splits at least not without wildcard matching, so I decided that an unordered comparison is good enough. The tests here also have unique lines, so there should be a very small chance for it to go wrong here.

> I thought about combining lines, but it won't work for splits at least not without wildcard matching

Ah, that makes sense.

> The verbosity is still greatly reduced when actually adding multigrid support, since the tests don't need to change depending on the mode.

oh, right. LGTM
Yes, if you are ok with these changes

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

labels.description: changes that are not features or bugfixes
labels.name: refactor

title: refactor(tests): don't compare the full screen in mouse_spec
